function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Social norms as a strong predictor of adoption intention and willingness to pay for energy-related and well-being features","Impact":"Risk of contagious behavior and influence leading to widespread adoption or rejection of features","Mitigation":"Education and awareness campaigns to promote informed decision-making and reduce the influence of social norms","Technologies":"Social media monitoring and sentiment analysis to understand and counteract social norm impacts","People":"Community members, residents, and consumers of energy and well-being features","Owner":"Government agencies, energy companies, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Variable effects of cost concerns on adoption intention and willingness to pay for energy and well-being features","Impact":"Risk of inconsistent behavior and decisions based on cost concerns, leading to unpredictable adoption and rejection of features","Mitigation":"Provide clear and transparent cost-benefit analyses to address and alleviate cost concerns","Technologies":"Cost modeling and simulation tools to evaluate the impact of cost concerns on adoption intention","People":"Consumers, residents, and stakeholders evaluating energy and well-being features","Owner":"Market researchers, product developers, and policymakers"},{"Description":"Relationship between trust in utilities and willingness to pay for well-being features","Impact":"Risk of utilities influencing residents' well-being through perceived trust, potentially leading to unforeseen consequences on community health","Mitigation":"Transparent communication and oversight to ensure utilities prioritize community well-being over profit","Technologies":"Utility performance monitoring and data analysis to assess the impact of trust on well-being feature adoption","People":"Residents, utility customers, and community members","Owner":"Regulatory bodies, utility companies, and consumer protection organizations"}]}
